intro: Xylinabariopsis, commonly known as the rare tropical orchid, is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae). It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring showy, fragrant blooms that attract specific pollinators. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in the understory of tropical rainforests. Xylinabariopsis has small, strap-like leaves and produces pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
